title: Drawing, 1938-88-2948, 1750–75
medium: Pen and black ink; brush and black wash and white gouache over a green crayon wash.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Hercules is seated on the left volute of a pediment featuring a medallion portrait of a woman. On the right volute, a woman is seated against a background of a trophy with attributes of war. She gestures toward the medallion.
